lexUnit.name: fret.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be constantly or visibly anxious.

sentence.text: Businessmen fretted that no good could come of such defiance ; students delighted in the courage of their mainland counterparts .
When agronomists held courses for peasants , they fretted that on average only 150 turned up , as compared with attendances of 4000 at a single conference in Smolensk guberniia .
AMERICANS are fretting again that their economic recovery is frail .
Worried parents fretted that their children would be exposed to X-rated happenings .
I have fretted dutifully over rival buggy-designs at Mothercare , I 've read my Michel Odent and I have mopped a sweating brow through two epic labours .
Richard 's fretting about dinner . "
Few in the finance ministry will fret about this .
Do n't fret about Jonathon , Melanie .
He stopped fretting about his life and about the future , about what was good or bad in it .
It ca n't help that he is fretting about possessions when he should be worrying about the state of his marriage .
There was so much to achieve and I fretted endlessly about the work that was needed to co-ordinate it all .
The Emperor 's veterans , fretting against the injustices of Bourbon France , had welcomed Napoleon 's return and flocked to the Eagles .

Understandably , she fretted at this circumscribed lifestyle , but another episode of somewhat more serious bleeding two weeks ago had convinced everyone that the programme of rest and professional care was not an overcautious one .
Still , it 's natural for the novelist sometimes to fret at the obliquities of fiction .
Manning Jackson had been fretting for several minutes .
Adam wondered if Abigail sometimes woke up and looked for him in the dark , in the empty room , and fretted for a while before she began to cry .
She 's fretting over Garry 's absence , and according to her doctor it 's important that he gets in touch with her without delay . "
I thought you 'd only fret over it . "
The other directors can only fret quietly in their seats .
Last , but not least , workers have fretted about being displaced by machines ever since the invention of the printing press .

Waking or sleeping his mind fretted away at the case , images drifted in and out of his consciousness , words and phrases came to mind in a confusing jumble but once , in a doze , it seemed that Beryl was actually speaking to him in her clear , cracked voice .
Companies outside COSE 's inner circle also fret about how it 's selecting technologies .
Nato may fret over the soul of West Germany .
The British colony , already fretting over whether China will give its nod to an expensive new airport in the territory , can ill afford the economic blow of a change in China 's status .
Now Lamb must spend the weekend fretting over whether the TCCB will ban him from next Saturday 's NatWest Trophy final .
Blanche had been doomed to fight for her promotion , watch her weight , and fret over her childlessness .
At the end of February Jimmy Nicholl had fretted over how the Raith players would cope with ` the mad month " which lay ahead .
` Girl , never doubt but he 'll come back to you whole and hungry , as he always used to from the butts or the wrestling when you were fretting over his lateness . "
She almost laughed when she reflected that here was she fretting about whether Time would give him back to her or not .
` You fret too much , " said Ymor , without taking his eyes from the two men opposite him .
` We do n't put him next to other horses , but he can see them clearly , only a field away , and he does n't fret or bother at all .
His horse fretted , its haunches nudging its neighbours , and flayed the air with a hoof .
